abstract: Apple has managed logic-defying growth via its combination of popular hardware, software and services. But its formula may face longer-term challenges.
snippet: Apple has managed logic-defying growth via its combination of popular hardware, software and services. But its formula may face longer-term challenges.
lead_paragraph: SIZE is the enemy of growth. It is one of the unwritten laws of business, a matter of simple percentages. After all, when a company has $1 billion in yearly sales, an extra $1 billion doubles its size. Add $1 billion in new business to a $10 billion-a-year company, and it amounts to just 10 percent growth. The size-growth tradeoff seems inevitable, an inescapable force like gravity.

headline.main: The Power of the Platform at Apple
